course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Privacy Management in the Digital Age
course.description: This course provides an overview of privacy management in the digital age. It covers the fundamental concepts and dimensions of privacy, the regulatory requirements, and various management tools to comply with data protection laws and meet public expectation. Through the analysis of privacy impacts on a number of new technologies such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, cloud, data analytics and their applications, students may learn how to respect individuals’ privacy when applying technologies.

reviews.author: jeremykuok0104
reviews.comment_content: Content mainly covers the privacy management  in Hong Kong and some about in Europe.
reviews.comment_teaching: For the first 3 or 4 courses, the content is quite good. You will get touch with how to conduct privacy analysis on a conduct. But the following courses are boring since it keeps using the same analysis over all the situations and there are some laws included. Also, every course includes about 20 min discussion. The discussion is included in the participation mark. There are quizzes every course. Only winners will add marks.
reviews.comment_workload: only one essay assignment . But time is not enough for the exam.

reviews.author: Lokhosun
reviews.title: Interesting course with a lot of updated life case
reviews.comment_content: I like about the content and the cases on current day big data and analytic case study and impact from a data privacy and law protection point of view
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is interesting. A lot participation are required. Class participation count to 20% of the course. But there are a lot group discussion session so it is not hard if you try.
reviews.comment_grading:
From what I heard Henry grades are quite good.

I also get good grade with reasonable effort.
reviews.comment_workload:
It is quite flexible. There are a lot of weekly reading but you are not required to read them all.

But the reading material are useful
If you want to get better grade or simply learn more about the topic.

Assignment:
The topic and questions are already given and set on class 1. So technically you can start early if you are a early planner. Submission is mid term and the question set are relevant to the taught subjects. I think the workload is ok. I took me a weekend to work on and the grade was ok.

Final exam is open book and note (computer allowed as long as not connected to Internet). So you can prepare material before entering the exam. The exam is moderately hard and I don’t think time allow to scrape book and note inside the exam.
A lot writing in 3 hour exam.
